definition: move from one place to another; travel
examples: he went out to the store
she longs to go back home
we've got a long way to go

definition: travel a specified distance
examples: you just have to go a few miles to get to the road

definition: travel or move in order to engage in a specified activity or course of action
examples: let's go and have a beer
we went to see her
she used to go hunting

definition: attend or visit for a particular purpose
examples: we went to the movies
he went to Brown University

definition: (of a rank or honor) be allotted or awarded
examples: the top prize went to a twenty-four-year-old sculptor

definition: (of a thing) lie or extend in a certain direction
examples: the scar started just above her ankle and went all the way up inside her leg

definition: change in level, amount, or rank in a specified direction
examples: prices went up by 15 percent

definition: said in various expressions when angrily or contemptuously dismissing someone
examples: go and get stuffed

definition: used to emphasize the speaker's annoyance at a specified action or event
examples: then he goes and spoils it all
don't go poking your nose where you shouldn't

definition: begin motion (used in a starter's order to begin a race)
examples: ready, set, go!

definition: leave; depart
examples: I really must go

definition: (of time) pass or elapse
examples: the hours went by
three years went past

definition: pass a specified amount of time in a particular way or under particular circumstances
examples: sometimes they went for two months without talking

definition: come to an end; cease to exist
examples: a golden age that has now gone for good
11,500 jobs are due to go by next year

definition: leave or resign from a post
examples: I tried to persuade the Chancellor not to go

definition: die (used euphemistically)
examples: I'd like to see my grandchildren before I go

definition: be lost or stolen
examples: when he returned minutes later, his equipment was gone

definition: (of money) be spent, especially in a specified way
examples: the rest of his money went into medical expenses

definition: intend or be likely or intended to be or do something; be about to (used to express a future tense)
examples: I'm going to be late for work
she's going to have a baby

definition: pass into a specified state, especially an undesirable one
examples: the food is going bad
he's gone crazy
her mind immediately went blank

definition: enter into a specified state, institution, or course of action
examples: she turned over and went back to sleep
the car went into a spin
no one went hungry in our house

definition: make a sound of a specified kind
examples: the engine went bang

definition: (of a bell or similar device) make a sound in functioning
examples: I heard the buzzer go four times

definition: proceed in a specified way or have a specified outcome; turn out
examples: how did the weekend go?
it all went off smoothly

definition: be acceptable or permitted
examples: underground events where anything goes

definition: be harmonious, complementary, or matching
examples: rosemary goes with roast lamb
the earrings and the scarf don't really go

definition: be found in the same place or situation; be associated
examples: cooking and eating go together

definition: (of a machine or device) function
examples: my car won't go

definition: continue in operation or existence
examples: the committee was kept going even when its existence could no longer be justified

definition: (of a thing) contribute to or be put into (a whole); be used for or devoted to
examples: considerable effort went into making the operation successful

definition: used to indicate how many people a supply of food, money, or another resource is sufficient for or how much can be achieved using it
examples: the sale will go a long way toward easing the huge debt burden
a little luck can go a long way

definition: (of an article) be regularly kept or put in a particular place
examples: remember which card goes in which slot

definition: fit or be able to be accommodated in a particular place or space
examples: you're trying to fit a round peg into a square hole, and it just won't go

definition: (of a song, account, verse, etc.) have a specified content or wording
examples: if you haven't heard it, the story goes like this

definition: be known or called by (a specified name)
examples: he now goes under the name Charles Perez

definition: say
examples: the kids go, “Yeah, sure.”

definition: use a toilet; urinate or defecate.
an attempt or trial at something
examples: I thought I'd give it a go

definition: a person's turn to use or do something
examples: I had a go on Nigel's racing bike
come on Tony, it's your go

definition: used in reference to a single item, action, or spell of activity
examples: he put it to his lips then knocked it back in one go

definition: spirit, animation, or energy
examples: there's no go in me at all these days

definition: vigorous activity
examples: it's all go around here

definition: a state of affairs
examples: this seems a rum sort of go

definition: an attack of illness
examples: he's had this nasty go of dysentery

definition: a project or undertaking that has been approved
examples: tell them the project is a go

definition: functioning properly
examples: all systems go

definition: a Japanese board game of territorial possession and capture.
give a spoken or written account of something that one has observed, heard, done, or investigated
examples: the representative reported a decline in milk and meat production
police reported that the flood waters were abating
the teacher should report on the child's progress

definition: cover an event or subject as a journalist or a reporter
examples: the public disliked the way that the media reported on the scandal
the Egyptian news agency reported that a coup attempt had taken place
the paper reported a secret program by the country to build nuclear warheads

definition: used to indicate that something has been stated, although one cannot confirm its accuracy
examples: these hoaxers are reported to be hacking into airline frequencies to impersonate air traffic controllers

definition: make a formal statement or complaint about (someone or something) to the necessary authority
examples: undisclosed illegalities are reported to the company's directors
eight horses have been reported missing in the last month

definition: (of a legislative committee) formally announce that the committee has dealt with (a bill)
examples: the Chairman shall report the Bill to the House

definition: present oneself formally as having arrived at a particular place or as ready to do something
examples: he was given three days to say goodbye to his family and report for active duty

definition: be responsible to (a superior or supervisor)
examples: the appointee will report to the chairman of the committee

definition: an account given of a particular matter, especially in the form of an official document, after thorough investigation or consideration by an appointed person or body
examples: the chairman's annual report

definition: a spoken or written description of an event or situation, especially one intended for publication or broadcast in the media
examples: press reports suggested that the government was still using secret police to help maintain public order

definition: a teacher's written assessment of a student's work, progress, and conduct, issued at the end of a term or academic year.
a detailed formal account of a case heard in a court, giving the main points in the judgment, especially as prepared for publication.
a piece of information that is unsupported by firm evidence and that the speaker feels may or may not be true
examples: reports were circulating that the chairman was about to resign

definition: rumor
examples: report has it that the beetles have now virtually disappeared

definition: a sudden loud noise of or like an explosion or gunfire.
an employee who is supervised by another employee
examples: all of his reports are twenty-somethings with no concept of proper attire for work

definition: the way in which someone or something is regarded; reputation
examples: whatsoever things are lovely and of good report

definition: operate and control the direction and speed of a motor vehicle
examples: he got into his car and drove off
they drove back into town

definition: (of a motor vehicle) travel under the control of a driver
examples: a car drives up, and a man gets out
a stream of black cars drove by

definition: own or use (a specified type of motor vehicle)
examples: Sue drives an old Chevy

definition: be licensed or competent to drive a motor vehicle
examples: I take it you can drive?

definition: convey (someone) in a vehicle, especially a private car
examples: Shelley drove him to the supermarket

definition: propel or carry along by force in a specified direction
examples: the wind will drive you onshore

definition: (of wind, water, or snow) move or fall with great force
examples: the snow drove against him

definition: (of a source of power) provide the energy to set and keep (an engine or piece of machinery) in motion
examples: turbines driven by steam

definition: (of a device) power or operate (another device)
examples: the interface can be used to drive a printer

definition: force (a stake or nail) into place by hitting or pushing it
examples: nails are driven through the boards

definition: bore (a tunnel).
(in ball games) hit or kick (the ball) hard with a free swing of the bat, racket, or foot.
strike (a ball) from the tee, typically with a driver.
urge or force (animals or people) to move in a specified direction
examples: they drove a flock of sheep through the center of the city
the French infantry were driven back

definition: compel to leave
examples: troops drove out the demonstrators
he wanted to drive me away

definition: (of a fact or feeling) compel (someone) to act in a particular way, especially one that is considered undesirable or inappropriate
examples: he was driven by ambition
some people are driven to murder their tormentors

definition: bring (someone) forcibly into a specified negative state
examples: the thought drove him to despair
my laziness drives my wife crazy

definition: force (someone) to work to an excessive extent
examples: you're driving yourself too hard

definition: cause (something abstract) to happen or develop
examples: the consumer has been driving the economy for a number of years
we need to allow market forces to drive growth in the telecommunications sector

definition: a trip or journey in a car
examples: they went for a drive in the country

definition: a street or road
examples: Hammond Drive

definition: a short road leading from a public road to a house or other building
examples: from the window he could see right down the weedy drive to the front gate

definition: an innate, biologically determined urge to attain a goal or satisfy a need
examples: emotional and sexual drives

definition: determination and ambition to achieve something
examples: her drive has sustained her through some shattering personal experiences

definition: an organized effort by a number of people to achieve a particular purpose, often to raise money
examples: we're planning a massive membership drive

definition: a series of offensive plays that advance the ball for the purpose of a score
examples: an 80-yard scoring drive

definition: the transmission of power to machinery or to the wheels of a motor vehicle.
